Air Elemental.name: Air Elemental
Air Elemental.flavor:
"The East Wind, an interloper in the dominions of Westerly Weather, is an impassive-faced tyrant with a sharp poniard held behind his back for a treacherous stab."
—Joseph Conrad, *The Mirror of the Sea*

Boomerang.name: Boomerang
Boomerang.text: Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Boomerang.flavor: Early Jamuraan hunters devised a weapon that would return to its source. Tolarian Æthermancers developed a spell that skipped the weapon entirely.

Cloud Sprite.name: Cloud Sprite
Cloud Sprite.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Cloud Sprite can block only creatures with flying.
Cloud Sprite.flavor: The delicate sprites carry messages for Saprazzans, but they refuse to land in Mercadia City's filthy markets.

Counterbore.name: Counterbore
Counterbore.text: Counter target spell. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that spell and exile them. Then that player shuffles.

rulings.text: Counterbore has no effect on cards on the battlefield that have the same name as the targeted spell.
The cards you’re searching for must be found if they’re in the graveyard, because that’s a zone everyone can see. Finding those cards in the hand and library is optional, though.

In most cases, Counterbore will exile the targeted spell. Its first sentence counters the spell, which puts it into its owner’s graveyard. Its second sentence then removes it from the graveyard. However, there are some exceptions to this, as listed below.

If the spell’s controller isn’t the same as its owner (due to Commandeer, for example), it won’t be exiled. The spell is countered and put into its owner’s graveyard. Then the spell’s controller’s graveyard, hand, and library are searched.

If the targeted spell can’t be countered (it’s Vexing Shusher, for example), that spell will remain on the stack. Counterbore will continue to resolve. You still get to search for and exile all other cards with that name.

Deluge.name: Deluge
Deluge.flavor:
"From the sea came all life, and to the sea it will return. The sooner the better."
—Emperor Aboshan

Denizen of the Deep.name: Denizen of the Deep
Denizen of the Deep.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
Denizen of the Deep.flavor: According to merfolk legend, a denizen of the deep swallows the horizon at the end of each day, bringing on the cold blanket of night.

Essence Scatter.name: Essence Scatter
Essence Scatter.flavor: Some wizards compete not to summon the most interesting creatures, but to create the most interesting aftereffects when a summons goes awry.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

Evacuation.name: Evacuation
Evacuation.text: Return all creatures to their owners' hands.
Evacuation.flavor:
"Once I supply the breeze, you'll see your warriors for the smoke they truly are."
—Alexi, zephyr mage

Mahamoti Djinn.name: Mahamoti Djinn
Mahamoti Djinn.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Mahamoti Djinn.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

Mind Control.name: Mind Control
Mind Control.text:
Enchant creature
You control enchanted creature.
Mind Control.flavor:
"Why fight the body when you can dominate the mind that rules it?"
—Jace Beleren

rulings.text: Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

Mind Spring.name: Mind Spring
Mind Spring.flavor: Fragments of thought refract and multiply, surging in a geyser of dizzying insight.

Negate.name: Negate
Negate.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

rulings.text: A “creature spell” is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

Phantom Warrior.name: Phantom Warrior
Phantom Warrior.flavor:
"The construction of a defense is not accomplished by adding bricks."
—Jace Beleren

Snapping Drake.name: Snapping Drake
Snapping Drake.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Snapping Drake.flavor: Foul-tempered, poorly trained, and mule-stubborn, the drake is the perfect test of the master's will.

Thieving Magpie.name: Thieving Magpie
Thieving Magpie.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever Thieving Magpie deals damage to an opponent, draw a card.
Thieving Magpie.flavor: Other birds collect twigs for their nests. Magpies collect jewels for theirs.

Unsummon.name: Unsummon
Unsummon.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
Unsummon.flavor: Mages routinely summon creatures from the Æther. It's only fair that they occasionally throw one back.

Abyssal Specter.name: Abyssal Specter
Abyssal Specter.text:
Flying
Whenever Abyssal Specter deals damage to a player, that player discards a card.
Abyssal Specter.flavor: To gaze under its hood is to invite death.

Ascendant Evincar.name: Ascendant Evincar
Ascendant Evincar.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Other black creatures get +1/+1.
Nonblack creatures get -1/-1.
Ascendant Evincar.flavor: His soul snared by an angel's curse, Crovax twisted heroism into its purest shadow.

rulings.text: If Ascendant Evincar stops being black, it gives itself -1/-1.

Consume Spirit.name: Consume Spirit
Consume Spirit.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Consume Spirit deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the number chosen for X, not the amount of damage Consume Spirit deals (in case some of it is prevented).
If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time Consume Spirit would resolve, the entire spell doesn’t resolve. You won’t gain any life.

Crowd of Cinders.name: Crowd of Cinders
Crowd of Cinders.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Crowd of Cinders's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black permanents you control.
Crowd of Cinders.flavor: They envy the life-giving heat so much that they tear it from those who still possess it.

Drudge Skeletons.name: Drudge Skeletons
Drudge Skeletons.text: {B}: Regenerate Drudge Skeletons. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
Drudge Skeletons.flavor:
"The dead make good soldiers. They can't disobey orders, never surrender, and don't stop fighting when a random body part falls off."
—Nevinyrral, *Necromancer's Handbook*

Dusk Imp.name: Dusk Imp
Dusk Imp.flavor: Imps are just intelligent enough to have an understanding of cruelty.

Essence Drain.name: Essence Drain
Essence Drain.text: Essence Drain deals 3 damage to any target and you gain 3 life.
Essence Drain.flavor:
"The elves are right: Death inevitably leads to life. But the truly powerful don't just experience this cycle. They control it."
—Crovax, ascendant evincar

rulings.text: If the target permanent or player is an illegal target when Essence Drain tries to resolve, it won’t resolve and none of its effects will happen. You won’t gain 3 life.

Eyeblight's Ending.name: Eyeblight's Ending
Eyeblight's Ending.flavor:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

Megrim.name: Megrim
Megrim.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
Megrim.flavor:
"It's a vicious circle. Stress breeds pain. Pain breeds stress. It's simply beautiful, wouldn't you agree?"
—Vradeen, vampire nocturnus

Mind Rot.name: Mind Rot
Mind Rot.flavor:
"The beauty of mental attacks is that your victims never remember them."
—Volrath

Mind Shatter.name: Mind Shatter
Mind Shatter.text: Target player discards X cards at random.
Mind Shatter.flavor: Dark thoughts hatch and twist within the mind, straining to take wing.

Moonglove Winnower.name: Moonglove Winnower
Moonglove Winnower.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
Moonglove Winnower.flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

Mortivore.name: Mortivore
Mortivore.text:
Mortivore's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards.
{B}: Regenerate Mortivore.

Ravenous Rats.name: Ravenous Rats
Ravenous Rats.text: When Ravenous Rats enters the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
Ravenous Rats.flavor: Nothing is sacred to rats. Everything is simply another meal.

Sengir Vampire.name: Sengir Vampire
Sengir Vampire.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
Sengir Vampire.flavor: Empires rise and fall, but evil is eternal.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger. It doesn’t matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire’s ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

Severed Legion.name: Severed Legion
Severed Legion.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Severed Legion.flavor: No one in Aphetto answers a knock at the door after sundown.

Terror.name: Terror
Terror.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

Underworld Dreams.name: Underworld Dreams
Underworld Dreams.text: Whenever an opponent draws a card, Underworld Dreams deals 1 damage to that player.
Underworld Dreams.flavor:
"In the drowsy dark cave of the mind, dreams build their nest with fragments dropped from day's caravan."
—Rabindranath Tagore

rulings.text: If multiple cards are drawn at once, this card triggers once for each card drawn.
In a multi-player game, it affects all opponents.
If a spell or ability causes you to put cards into your hand without specifically using the word “draw,” it’s not a card drawn.

Unholy Strength.name: Unholy Strength
Unholy Strength.flavor:
"Born under the moon, the second child will stumble on temptation and seek power in the dark places of the heart."
—Codex of the Constellari

Act of Treason.name: Act of Treason
Act of Treason.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gains haste until end of turn. (It can attack and {T} this turn.)
Act of Treason.flavor:
"Rage courses in every heart, yearning to betray its rational prison."
—Sarkhan Vol

rulings.text: Act of Treason can target any creature, even one that’s untapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn’t cause you to gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

Banefire.name: Banefire
Banefire.text:
Banefire deals X damage to any target.
If X is 5 or more, this spell can't be countered and the damage can't be prevented.
Banefire.flavor: For Sarkhan Vol, the dragon is the purest expression of life's savage splendor.

rulings.text: To determine whether it can be countered and its damage can be prevented, Banefire checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent or the amount of damage it will actually deal.

Banefire can be targeted by spells that try to counter it regardless of what the value of X is. If X is 5 or more, those spells will still resolve, but the part of their effect that would counter Banefire won’t do anything. Any other effects those spells have will work as normal.
If its target is illegal by the time Banefire tries to resolve, the spell isn’t countered, but it doesn’t resolve. The target won’t be dealt damage.

Blaze.name: Blaze
Blaze.text: Blaze deals X damage to any target.

Bloodmark Mentor.name: Bloodmark Mentor
Bloodmark Mentor.text: Red creatures you control have first strike.
Bloodmark Mentor.flavor: Boggarts divide the world into two categories: things you can eat, and things you have to chase down and pummel before you can eat.

Cinder Pyromancer.name: Cinder Pyromancer
Cinder Pyromancer.text:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.
Cinder Pyromancer.flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."

Earth Elemental.name: Earth Elemental
Earth Elemental.flavor: Earth elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

Enrage.name: Enrage
Enrage.text: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
Enrage.flavor: The barbarians call it "touching the soul of the dragon."

Furnace of Rath.name: Furnace of Rath
Furnace of Rath.text: If a source would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals double that damage to that permanent or player instead.
Furnace of Rath.flavor: The furnace awaits the next master who would stoke the fires of apocalypse.

rulings.text: If a spell or ability damages multiple things, divide up the damage before applying this effect. This means you can’t normally end up with an odd amount of damage on something.
The trample rules cause damage to be divided before it is doubled.
If you have two of these on the battlefield, the damage is multiplied by 4.
The multiplied damage counts in all ways as if it came from the original source. Furnace of Rath is not the source.

If multiple effects modify how damage will be dealt, the player who would be dealt damage or the controller of the creature that would be dealt damage chooses the order to apply the effects. For example, Mending Hands says, “Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.” Suppose a spell would deal 5 damage to a player who has cast Mending Hands targeting themselves. That player can either (a) prevent 4 damage first and then let Furnace of Rath double the remaining 1 damage, taking 2 damage, or (b) double the damage to 10 and then prevent 4 damage, taking 6 damage.

Goblin Piker.name: Goblin Piker
Goblin Piker.flavor: Once he'd worked out which end of the thing was sharp, he was promoted to guard duty.

Goblin Sky Raider.name: Goblin Sky Raider
Goblin Sky Raider.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Goblin Sky Raider.flavor: The goblin word for "flying" is more accurately translated as "falling slowly."

Hill Giant.name: Hill Giant
Hill Giant.flavor: Fortunately, hill giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

Incinerate.name: Incinerate
Incinerate.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
Incinerate.flavor:
"Yes, I think 'toast' is an appropriate description."
—Jaya Ballard, task mage

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won’t do anything. The creature can’t be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

Kamahl, Pit Fighter.name: Kamahl, Pit Fighter
Kamahl, Pit Fighter.text:
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
{T}: Kamahl, Pit Fighter deals 3 damage to any target.
Kamahl, Pit Fighter.flavor: In times when freedom seems lost, great souls arise to reclaim it.

rulings.text: The Legend rule only applies to two legendary permanents with identical names. If the names are different, even if they depict the same character, the rule does not apply.

Lightning Elemental.name: Lightning Elemental
Lightning Elemental.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
Lightning Elemental.flavor:
"A flash of the lightning, a break of the wave, He passes from life to his rest in the grave."
—William Knox, "Mortality"

Prodigal Pyromancer.name: Prodigal Pyromancer
Prodigal Pyromancer.text: {T}: Prodigal Pyromancer deals 1 damage to any target.
Prodigal Pyromancer.flavor: "What am I looking at? Ashes, dead man."

Rage Reflection.name: Rage Reflection
Rage Reflection.text: Creatures you control have double strike.
Rage Reflection.flavor: Vengeance is a dish best served twice.

rulings.text: If a creature loses double strike after assigning damage in the “first strike” combat damage step (due to Rage Reflection leaving the battlefield, for example), that creature won’t assign damage in the “normal” combat damage step.

Shivan Dragon.name: Shivan Dragon
Shivan Dragon.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Shivan Dragon.flavor: The undisputed master of the mountains of Shiv.

Shock.name: Shock
Shock.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
Shock.flavor:
"Once I saw a goblin shouting at a thunderstorm. He lost the argument pretty quickly."
—Wandering mage

Blanchwood Armor.name: Blanchwood Armor
Blanchwood Armor.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each Forest you control.
Blanchwood Armor.flavor:
"Before armor, there was bark. Before blades, there were thorns."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

Civic Wayfinder.name: Civic Wayfinder
Civic Wayfinder.text: When Civic Wayfinder enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
Civic Wayfinder.flavor: "These alleys are not safe. Come, I can guide you back to the market square."

Drove of Elves.name: Drove of Elves
Drove of Elves.text:
Hexproof
Drove of Elves's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green permanents you control.
Drove of Elves.flavor: "The light of beauty protects our journeys through darkness."

Duskdale Wurm.name: Duskdale Wurm
Duskdale Wurm.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

Elven Riders.name: Elven Riders
Elven Riders.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
Elven Riders.flavor: "Wirewood cannot hide great size. Only with speed and skill can we survive here."

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

Elvish Champion.name: Elvish Champion
Elvish Champion.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
Elvish Champion.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

Elvish Eulogist.name: Elvish Eulogist
Elvish Eulogist.text: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
Elvish Eulogist.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."

rulings.text: By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

Elvish Promenade.name: Elvish Promenade
Elvish Promenade.text: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token for each Elf you control.
Elvish Promenade.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

Elvish Visionary.name: Elvish Visionary
Elvish Visionary.text: When Elvish Visionary enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Elvish Visionary.flavor: Before any major undertaking, a Cylian elf seeks the guidance of a visionary to learn the will of the gargantuan ancients.

Elvish Warrior.name: Elvish Warrior
Elvish Warrior.flavor: As graceful as a deer leaping a stream and as deadly as the wolf waiting in ambush on the other side, elvish warriors are the eyes of the forest as well as its unsheathed claws.

Gaea's Herald.name: Gaea's Herald
Gaea's Herald.flavor: "Gaea sings with the voice of nature rampant: a thousand howls, chitters, and cries, and none of them can be ignored."

rulings.text: The ability applies to your opponent’s spells as well as your own.

Giant Growth.name: Giant Growth
Giant Growth.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

Giant Spider.name: Giant Spider
Giant Spider.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Giant Spider.flavor: The giant spider's silk naturally resists gravity, almost weaving itself as it blankets the forest canopy.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

Greenweaver Druid.name: Greenweaver Druid
Greenweaver Druid.flavor: The other tribes call them fanatics, but none deny that the Mul Daya elves have an iron-strong bond to some force greater than themselves.

Howl of the Night Pack.name: Howl of the Night Pack
Howl of the Night Pack.text: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token for each Forest you control.
Howl of the Night Pack.flavor: The murderous horrors of Raven's Run are legendary, but even that haunted place goes quiet when the night wolves howl.

rulings.text: The number of Wolves you put onto the battlefield is based on the number of Forests you control when Howl of the Night Pack resolves.
Howl of the Night Pack counts any land you control with the subtype Forest, not just ones named Forest.

Immaculate Magistrate.name: Immaculate Magistrate
Immaculate Magistrate.text: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.
Immaculate Magistrate.flavor: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.

rulings.text: The number of counters to put on the target creature is determined only as Immaculate Magistrate’s ability resolves. Elves coming and going later won’t cause that creature to gain or lose +1/+1 counters.
The target creature doesn’t have to be an Elf.

Imperious Perfect.name: Imperious Perfect
Imperious Perfect.text:
Other Elves you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
Imperious Perfect.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until the damage is removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Elves you control may become lethal if Imperious Perfect leaves the battlefield during that turn.

Jagged-Scar Archers.name: Jagged-Scar Archers
Jagged-Scar Archers.text:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

Lys Alana Huntmaster.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
Lys Alana Huntmaster.text: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may create a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token.
Lys Alana Huntmaster.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

rulings.text: Lys Alana Huntmaster’s ability will resolve before the Elf spell that caused it to trigger.

Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer.name: Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Molimo, Maro-Sorcerer's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you control.

Natural Spring.name: Natural Spring
Natural Spring.flavor:
"Jewels cannot be eaten nor gold drunk. What civilization trades, nature simply provides."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

Naturalize.name: Naturalize
Naturalize.flavor: If you want to destroy something lifeless, make it live.

Nature's Spiral.name: Nature's Spiral
Nature's Spiral.text: Return target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
Nature's Spiral.flavor: Like nature, the fern spirals back on itself, eternally seeking its own center.

Overrun.name: Overrun
Overrun.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.

rulings.text: Overrun affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won’t affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

Rampant Growth.name: Rampant Growth
Rampant Growth.text: Search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
Rampant Growth.flavor: Nature grows solutions to its problems.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the “search” requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don’t have to find the card if you don’t want to.

River Boa.name: River Boa
River Boa.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
{G}: Regenerate River Boa.

Roughshod Mentor.name: Roughshod Mentor
Roughshod Mentor.text: Green creatures you control have trample.

Runeclaw Bear.name: Runeclaw Bear
Runeclaw Bear.flavor: Bears aren't always as strong and as mean as you imagine. Some are even stronger and meaner.

Spined Wurm.name: Spined Wurm
Spined Wurm.flavor: Its spines act like the teeth of a saw, scoring distinctive marks in the vegetation of its territory.

Talara's Battalion.name: Talara's Battalion
Talara's Battalion.text:
Cast this spell only if you've cast another green spell this turn.
Trample

Trained Armodon.name: Trained Armodon
Trained Armodon.flavor: Armodons are trained to step on things. Enemy things.

Troll Ascetic.name: Troll Ascetic
Troll Ascetic.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Troll Ascetic.

Verdant Force.name: Verdant Force
Verdant Force.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, create a 1/1 green Saproling creature token.
Verdant Force.flavor: Left to itself, nature overflows any container, overthrows any restriction, and overreaches any boundary.

rulings.text: In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per upkeep, not once for each player.
Verdant Force’s ability triggers at the beginning of each upkeep, not just each of your upkeeps.

Vigor.name: Vigor
Vigor.text:
Trample
If damage would be dealt to another creature you control, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.

rulings.text: The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner’s graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.

Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn’t *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn’t behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.

If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner’s library. However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn’t trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.

If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it will remain in its new zone when its owner shuffles their library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won’t trigger at all.

Wall of Wood.name: Wall of Wood
Wall of Wood.flavor: Orcish lumberjacks spent the night sharpening their blades and resting for a day of labor. They awoke to find that the forest had been making its own preparations.

Coat of Arms.name: Coat of Arms
Coat of Arms.text: Each creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares at least one creature type with it. (For example, if two Goblin Warriors and a Goblin Shaman are on the battlefield, each gets +2/+2.)
Coat of Arms.flavor: A banner for bonds of blood or belief.

rulings.text: If a creature has more than one creature type, and one of those types matches the creature you are calculating for, then count that creature. Only one type needs to match in order to get counted.
If you have a creature with more than one creature type, count all creatures which have either creature type.
Sharing multiple creature types doesn’t give an additional bonus. Coat of Arms counts creatures, not creature types.

Demon's Horn.name: Demon's Horn
Demon's Horn.text: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may gain 1 life.
Demon's Horn.flavor: Its curve mimics the twists of life and death.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a black spell.
If a player casts a black spell, Demon’s Horn’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Demon’s Horn’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

Dragon's Claw.name: Dragon's Claw
Dragon's Claw.text: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may gain 1 life.
Dragon's Claw.flavor: Though no longer attached to the hand, it still holds its adversary in its grasp.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a red spell.
If a player casts a red spell, Dragon’s Claw’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Dragon’s Claw’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

Kraken's Eye.name: Kraken's Eye
Kraken's Eye.text: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may gain 1 life.
Kraken's Eye.flavor: Bright as a mirror, dark as the sea.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a blue spell.
If a player casts a blue spell, Kraken’s Eye’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Kraken’s Eye’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

Loxodon Warhammer.name: Loxodon Warhammer
Loxodon Warhammer.text:
Equipped creature gets +3/+0 and has trample and lifelink.
Equip {3}

The Rack.name: The Rack
The Rack.text:
As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player as this card enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. It becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

Wall of Spears.name: Wall of Spears
Wall of Spears.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
First strike
Wall of Spears.flavor:
"A stick is your friend. A pointed stick is your good friend. An army of pointed sticks is your best friend."
—Onean sergeant

Wurm's Tooth.name: Wurm's Tooth
Wurm's Tooth.text: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may gain 1 life.
Wurm's Tooth.flavor: A wurm knows nothing of deception. If it opens its mouth, it plans to eat you.

rulings.text: The ability triggers whenever any player, not just you, casts a green spell.
If a player casts a green spell, Wurm’s Tooth’s ability triggers and is put on the stack on top of that spell. Wurm’s Tooth’s ability will resolve (causing you to gain 1 life) before the spell does.

Ravenous Baloth.name: Ravenous Baloth
Ravenous Baloth.text: Sacrifice a Beast: You gain 4 life.
Ravenous Baloth.flavor:
"All we know about the Krosan Forest we have learned from those few who made it out alive."
—Elvish refugee

Cunning Wish.name: Cunning Wish
Cunning Wish.text: You may reveal an instant card you own from outside the game and put it into your hand. Exile Cunning Wish.
Cunning Wish.flavor: The foolish wish for that which they desire. The cunning wish for that which they require.

rulings.text: Can’t acquire the Ante cards. They are considered still “in the game” as are cards in the library and the graveyard.
The choice is optional.
If you fail to find something, you still exile this.
Can’t acquire cards that are phased out.
You can’t acquire exiled cards because those cards are still in one of the game’s zones.
In a sanctioned event, a card that’s “outside the game” is one that’s in your sideboard. In an unsanctioned event, you may choose any card from your collection.

Yawgmoth's Will.name: Yawgmoth's Will
Yawgmoth's Will.text:
Until end of turn, you may play lands and cast spells from your graveyard.
If a card would be put into your graveyard from anywhere this turn, exile that card instead.

rulings.text: If you cast a Buyback spell, then there will be two effects trying to replace where the card goes. You get to choose if the Buyback returns the card to your hand or the card gets exiled.

If an effect asks you to discard a card, you can’t “discard” something that is in your graveyard. Those cards are not in your hand. Thus, Cycling abilities of cards in the graveyard can’t be activated.
The second ability creates a replacement effect. It applies to both costs and effects.
If you play a card using Yawgmoth’s Will and something triggers only when “cast from your hand”, that something will not trigger. Such things trigger based on where the card came from.
To “play a card” is to either cast a spell or to put a land onto the battlefield using the main phase special action.
It will exile itself since it goes to the graveyard after its effect starts.
You cannot Suspend a card from your graveyard, only your hand.

Vindicate.name: Vindicate
Vindicate.flavor: Some convictions are so strong that the world must break to accommodate them.

Decree of Justice.name: Decree of Justice
Decree of Justice.text:
Create X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.

The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability doesn’t resolve (due to being countered with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you’ll draw a card.
A mana cost of {X}{X} means that you pay twice X. If you want X to be 3, you pay {8}{W}{W} to cast Decree of Justice.
